project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hi!Can you provide at a preview of attribute objects? I mean the situation when an attribute is connected with another object type. It was convinient to see a preview on aiming a mouse cursor.The same concerns Inbound References groups. It would be nice to have an ability to preview referenced objects.
fields.summary: Preview for objects

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: For cases where insight objects are the source for new object types it would be great if Insight would support a "Insight Objects" as a separate import source type.Possible use cases: * RAW data is imported as is in the first step and then consolidated/transformed/filtered into multiple insight object types *  New object types is derived from existing object types
fields.summary: Support Insight Object Schemas as import types source

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: *Summary:*It would be great if Insight would allow to transform the JSON data of the source to better match the intended structure within Insight. JQ ([https://stedolan.github.io/jq/]]) and the Java-based OpenSource implementation Jackson-JQ ([https://github.com/eiiches/jackson-jq]) do just that.*Use case / current workaround:*I'd like to give you some more information about how I'm currently importing data from JSON-based REST APIs into Insight by converting them into CSV. Maybe you can make that process available within Insight, without having to pre-process the JSON data outside of Insight.I'm using JQ ([https://stedolan.github.io/jq/]]) to transform the JSON to a simple list of objects with attributes and then I use json2csv ([http://www.mircozeiss.com/json2csv/])]) to convert this list into CSV.*Here's a simple example:*Given the following JSON structure (as example):{code:java}{    "count": 94,    "next": null,    "previous": null,    "results": [        {            "subject": "...",            "subject_url": "...",            "subject_type": "Netbox",            "on_maintenance": false,            "acknowledgement": null,            "event_history_url": "...",            "netbox_history_url": "...",            "device_groups": [            ],            "alert_type": {                "name": "boxDown",                "description": "Box declared down."            },            "event_type": {                "id": "boxState",                "description": "Tells us whether a network-unit is down or up."            },            "start_time": "...",            "end_time": "...",            "id": 12461,            "source": "pping",            "device": null,            "netbox": 187,            "subid": "",            "value": 1,            "severity": 50        },        {           ...       }    ] }{code}I use the following command line to transform it to a CSV file that can be easily imported and works very well for auto-creating the object schema and the import object type mapping (which reduces manual work a lot):{code:java}curl -s <url> | jq '[.results[] | {id,subject,subject_url,subject_type,...}] | unique_by(.id)' | json2csv > data.csv{code}That produces the following intermediate JSON:{code:java}[  {    "id": 146,    "subject": "...",    "subject_url": "...",    "subject_type": "Netbox",    ... },  {   ... } ]{code}and in turn generates the following CSV:{code:java}"id","subject","subject_url","subject_type",...146,"...","...","Netbox",...{code}*Suggested implementation:*Since it does not make sense to depend on command line tools for a JIRA plugin a Java-based solution like Jackson-JQ ([https://github.com/eiiches/jackson-jq]).That way you get the full expressiveness of JQ to transform complex data into a simple table that can then be imported using automated creation of the schema and import mapping.
fields.summary: Support for JQ-based JSON transformations during import of JSON data

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hi!It would be nice to have some field showing mentions on confluence pages for an object. The same as JIRA connected issues are shown. Actually, in JIRA it works as 'mentioned in' in issue links field.
fields.summary: Showing object's mentions in wiki

fields.description: It should be possible to use placeholders for custom fields, to filter on issue fields.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hello,Currently, we do have a feature wherein we can connect Jira ticket to Insight object through Jira.Can/do we have a feature which lets Insight object be connected to Jira ticket? If we can have Attribute Type = Jira ticket and it lets us put a jira ticket Id while creating an object that should help.In my case, this is required when I dont want Insight object be visible from Jira form but be able to still link it to Jira ticket.Please advise.Regards,Anand
fields.summary: Ability to link Insight object to Jira ticket from Insight

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hello,what would be a great nice to have (without having to script it) is being able to simply configure this in a post function.What we're doing is: * A User (Object) has a Cost Center Manager (Object Reference) which at the same time is a User as well * Both have a JIRA User Attribute * I would like a User to be able to open a ticket and automatically assign an approval to his cost center manager, line manager or any other kind of Object field (which has a JIRA user reference)Use Case:With the "Set a JIRA custom field with the attribute value from a selected object" option this is basically already possible when the Cost Center Manager is a "JIRA User" attribute, but that would require JIRA User fields to be both "Object" & "JIRA User".Due to the Cost Center Manager being 'variable' User to user, it cannot simply add one person, but would have to add an Attribute in e.g. a requested 'Permission' which is a placeholder for User."Cost Center Manager"."JIRA User".What i'm trying to is establish Insight as an Asset Management as well as "Input" for an overall Workflow engine, which i think can work perfectly if put together.Best regardsThomas
fields.summary: Add on-board post function to add Approvers (or basically any kind of user picker field) based on Insight data

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hi Riada Team,I'd like to be able to specify the type of reference when I create/update objects, instead of having it fixed when creating an object type attribute. That is, when creating a link between two objects, I want to be able to dynamically choose the reference type. In the attached example for instance, we could use this to specify how a contact in a CRM was related to an organization so that we could still get a cool visualization from the object graph (unlike just having a select list).What we've done instead is created multiple object type attributes, one for each reference type (e.g., Employee, Contractor, Consultant in the example), but this gets a little cumbersome the more reference types we add.Thanks, and let me know if you want any more information.
fields.summary: Feature request: Choose reference type on object creation

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hi Riada,In the Automation section of an object schema's configuration settings, I'd like to be able to enter a Groovy script right into the web browser, not just a file path to a script (similar to what you can do with the ScriptRunner plugin for JIRA). I've included a mocked up screenshot of what I mean.I'd like this because although I'm a JIRA admin, I don't have access to the physical machine we run our server instance of JIRA on, so I don't think the file path option will work for me.Thanks, and let me know if you need any clarification.
fields.summary: Automation: Enter Groovy script directly into browser (not just file path)

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: It would be great if you could add a link on the Insight support page on Marketplace that is called "*Ask a question in the Community*" that takes you directly to the Create Question screen in community.atlassian.com  and pre-tag the question with your plugin-key: *addon-com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight*Today it is easy to miss this tag when creating a new question and there are serious issues when I try to get auto-complete to work on your tag adding it manually. In fact I can't find it at all! I have to  copy the entire string today. The risk is high that I add a false tag!If you could provide this link on Marketplace I think a lot more questions would be tagged correctly and the questions would be answered quicker. Cheers,// Svante
fields.summary: Create New Question link on Marketplace Support page

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I tried created a new import configuration by referring: [https://documentation.riada.se/insight/latest/insight-manager-s-guide/import-and-synchronization/create-your-own-import-type].

Was unable to find if the newly created import configuration can be exported to a json or any other format and then imported to a newer instance of insight rather than creating the configuration from the scratch on a new instance. Also when we have multiple instances, creating manually is not feasible
fields.summary: Exporting Import Configuration

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: We have a project going on with the need to get resources scheduled. It is not a calendar per se but a resource view/app with which one can schedule jobs and the resources required to complete the work. We would be interested in getting in touch with your people to find out what Insight can provide on the API level and what functionalities we need to implement ourselves.For example, it would be great to be able to use IQL to search for "all resources of type vehicle with diesel engine, available between yyyy-mm-dd and yyyy-mm-dd+2".In this particular context, a calendar as such is not enough. Or "calendar" like the way Office365 calendars work. Resource calendar will work for some of their use cases, like when you need special equipment or vehicles to be available and reserved for a particular "gig". That is one type of resource lock, i.e. the resource is _locked_ for a time period and needs to be _released_ before it is available for further use. Maybe the resource (again, vehicle or equipment) could be attached to another Insight object (or JIRA issue) between two timestamps. Or something... My thinking around this is not too clear yet and you probably have a number of approaches in mind based on the feature requests received from the field.Anyway, if you end up having a functional scheduling method for, say, electricians, plumbers, vehicles or such, you will have a lot of potential customers from the public sector and from companies (small to large).----I am interested in hearing about your plans related to calendaring, how much of the customer's requirements can be covered by your existing or future features, and how much we need to build on top of Insight's features ourselves.
fields.summary: Resource calendar / booking

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: **I am thinking of tracking expenses related to a Jira issue by adding Expense Insight objects (or something similar) to the issues. There can be 0..n expenses, each with their given type, unit, price, and so on. So fairly simple Insight object structure. Current Insight field wants to show me a search box but that does not make any sense with the Expense object type. I never want to search for an Expense and attach that to an issue; I only want to quickly open a dialog to create new Insight objects. Do you have any suggestions on how to implement something like this, and does the simple create button interface sound like a feasible small feature to add?
fields.summary: Simple create button

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: People often want to track things in a tabular format, especially when they are dealing with numbers. There's an add-on called Table Grid Editor that offers something like that but, generally speaking, Insight could do that as well.Rows in the table would be Insight objects, the table itself and the columns it displays, would be composed based on the attributes of the object type.As far as I understand, that could be just an alternative way to render the Insight objects. So instead of just displaying Insight objects as they currently are, you would get a table.This would work great with tracking Expenses, ICS-536 I suggested earlier. It would also make it possible to quickly visualise a larger number of attached objects on the issue view/edit screens. Think of quick-and-dirty Excel replacement and you start to see the number of potential use cases (infinite number).
fields.summary: Tabular interface to Insight objects on an issue

fields.description: A pretty common use case is to use Insight for richer user management than JIRA can provide. This opens up reporting cases where you want to filter issues on JIRA user fields and compare them to Insight IQL. As an example:In Insight we have all users imported as objects (either from JIRA or LDAP, but with a JIRA user connection). We then have a group structure created where users are referenced to.  We now like to use JQL to filter issues that was created by a user belonging to a specific group. An JQL like:project = demo And reporter in IQLFunction("ObjectType = User And Group = \"SU\”")
fields.summary: Make IQLFunction operate on user fields

Pls add possibility to specify icon for attributes of type URL.Thx in advance!Robert

fields.description: Our AD has this value in the objectSid on a group, user, whatever imported from AD:objectSid: S-1-5-21-2126658991-319633822-626671869-29753In AD this is a binary value. In Insight TextArea field, this is saved: �=�~�9 �@Z%1tI cannot save this value in a Insight field called objectSid. E.g: Someone renames a group in AD, so this renamed group is added as a new object in Insight when CN is the identifier. If the objectSid is used as identifier, this renamed group would just get a renamed name in the same Insight object, if objectSid is used as identifier.

fields.description: Sometimes we set  a Insight custom field to a defaultvalue (default object) in a Postfunction and then connect this field to a referenced field for the user to choose a value from.This way we can serve the users with not needing to choose too much in the JIRA screens as well as we secure certain statistical information for mgmt etc. However it also creates a vulnerability that the users/admin changes the object name, removes the object etc.  We need somehow a function to "lock down"  or highlight a specific object that is  used in a workflow or script. Righclick-flag and highlight object with a certain colour (same functionality as in Agile Boards) might work? Of course a solution is to add an attribute  called "flag" to the object type but depending on the view (list/detail) this attribute would perhaps not be so "in your face" that we need.

We would like to be able to show the user the cost for each model as well (which is an attribute for each object)!Multiple Attributes.png!Would it be possible when I configure my Insight Custom field to add an additional attribute in the select list so that it looks like the attached image? Cheers,// Svante

fields.description: When an object is not already available but the user needs to create it first, the user must go through some unnecessary hoops to get the new object displayed on the current screen's field.They first need to click on create new object icon, create the object, then come back to the same field they were originally displaying and search for the newly added object.A better approach would be to create the object and immediately add it to the field the user was working on. This is a usability change for the better. Currently users find it very unintuitive that they need to start searching for the object that they just created; i.e. they already feel that they told the system what they want to be included in the field by creating the object themselves.Original support request RPS-5460.

fields.description:
Actually it is not possible to have an Import IQL Filter that is using information based on reference objects. It is needed to filter object by reference during the import

*for example:*

just import host system where the reference operating system.name like windows

It is needed to add the possibility to add references with an IQL that using object references

*for example:*

Importing a network device which contains a list of "connected" mac addresses

these should be linked to host systems where the mac address information is available in a list of Networkintefaces. So the mapping IQL would be something like "Host".Networkinterface"."Mac Address" In (${MAC Address\{0}})
fields.summary: Import IQL Filter based on Reference-Object

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: We have computers in two different domains, called D1 and D2.Sometimes some of the computers are moved from one domain to the other.The computers have an agent checking in to a management tool in each of the domains.I have two database import jobs runing after each other, one for D1 and one for D2.Among others, the import job updates a date attribute called "Last check in date".(This date tells us when the computer was last used.)Problem: A computer was first in D2, and then it was moved to D1. The first import job (D1) sets the correct "Last check in date", but this is then overwritten by the second import job (D2) which sets "Last check in date" to the last time the computer was in that domain. I would like the possibility to define a pre-check of attributes before they (or the whole object) is updated.
fields.summary: Import: Pre-check functionallity before updating

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: With the new custom field types introduced in 5.4 that restrict the objects only by an IQL the object picker shows the whole object type tree in the sidebar on the left.Although i do understand why it works like this it is confusing for our users, especially when giving them the selection of inherited object types.*Example:*custom field "Server" with Filter Scope IQL:{code:java}objecttype in objectTypeAndChildren("Server"){code}Users should then be able to filter by the subtypes of "Server":!image-2018-03-09-11-09-40-236.png!Currently with the whole object type tree visible users may be confused as obviously selecting any other object type results in the message "no objects found".*Possible solutions*: * if the IQL contains filters on "objecttype" it should also filter the tree (prefered and awesome :)) * selection on what object types to show as it was before 5.4 Otherwise 5.4 introduced some really cool features we have been waiting for, keep up the good work!
fields.summary: Object picker shows whole object type tree

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: I would like to request the features described in RPS-5679.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: hi,lot of webservices are using the xml format. but, in the import interfaces, we can only import json or csv files through web adresses.in our company, we need to interface insight with a few webservices (in coming data). so, i think it would be a great feature to have the ability to use webservices (mostly rest apis) returning xml and directly interface them with insight...maybe i haven't found yet the functionnality though. thanks for your follow upregards
fields.summary: XML Import Module

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: We'd like to be able to use the synced JIRA User objects as a pseudo user picker field on a Service Desk request. We'd like it to display the current user by default, rather than be blank. Similar to the "Raise this request on behalf of" field  you see if you're a Service Desk agent.
fields.summary: Default object based on reporter

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: We have some post functions set up for a client to get them a list of email addresses from relevant users so that they can copy/paste them into an email that they want to manually generate. The issue is that they need the email addresses to be delimited by semi-colon not comma as they use Outlook for email and they use Last, First to display full names.For example, JSU allows for choosing the separator when appending values into a text field. !set_separator_JSU_post_function.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Choose separator in copy value post function

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: As now, the entries in the Status attribute does not have any order, not on color or name.Please add the option to sort/order the status by color and/or name so it will be easier for the user to find correct status.Now:(red) Status2(yellow) Status1(red) Status5(green) Status3(yellow) Status4 Wantet:(green) Status3(yellow) Status1(yellow) Status4(red) Status2(red) Status5and/or:(yellow) Status1(red) Status2(green) Status3(yellow) Status4(red) Status5
fields.summary: Be able to sort the Status attribute

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Exclude a Group so that they can only edit/delete one object at the time? And not edit/delete multiple issues at the same time.
fields.summary: bulk change permission

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: I have a "Users" object in which there is a multiple select containing a multiple select list of "Licenses". I then use the Two Dimensional Report Gadget on a Dashboard with XAsis "Licenses" and YAxsis "Name". This gives me a nice list of all users and a count of total usage of each license in the bottom. However, due to the number of users, this lists is long. And I am only interested in the numbers at the bottom. So I request a feature: A checkbox for the reports/gadget of this type "Only show aggregated numbers" (or something like this).
fields.summary: Two Dimensional Report with only aggregation count line

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Since many organisations depend on correct data in their Insight structure, it is important to get a notice when an import job fails. Now you will actually need to go in and look manually every day to see that it has been imported correctly. Add a setting for each object scheme (possibly with a global setting) of a number of mail addresses to alert when a job fails.
fields.summary: Add mail alerts for failing import jobs

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hey,We have a lot of power-users creating import jobs in their Insight schemas. Sometimes their job fails and they get a message referring to the logs on the server.These users do not have server access and need therefore JIRA admin assistance for this.eazyBI has solved this issue quite elegant by providing access to the logs via the UI(see attachment)Is this something you would consider for Insight as well? It would also be very valuable for the JIRA admins since they don't have to switch context when they need to follow stuff in the logsCheers,// Svante
fields.summary: Make Logs available in UI

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Can we have the option of customizing  Insight Interface into Russian?See the screenshot attached.That would be a benefit for our team and customers. !image-2018-05-10-12-05-43-544.png!
fields.summary: Customizing Insight (Russian)

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hi do you have any plans to offer a text-only multi-line text field? The Textarea takes up a lot of screen space because of all the buttons etc, and is often not required for our purposes. A simple multi-line text field (like this one I'm writing in on your portal) would be very useful. Thanks
fields.summary: Plain text Textarea field

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: h3. ProblemWhen you have Insight custom fields that contains objects, and you delete the object from Insight structure it will be forever removed from all issues having that value. As Insight in many cases are becoming more business critical it is a great danger as it is easy to delete an object by mistake. Users expect to get a warning when something dangerous like this is about to happen. As an admin I would expect the same behaviour for Insight fields as for a normal select list when removing an item.h3. Proposed solution #1If you try to delete an object that is connected to one or more issues, you should get a clear warning that you will remove values from issue fields. User would need to get information on: * Which fields that are concerned * A link to view all concerned issues - preferrably one link for each field to quickly being able to do a bulk change.h3. Proposed solution #2In addition to the solution above, let the user select how to remap the values for the issues having the object in concern. Much in the same way as when you remove a select list item of a normal custom field as an admin.
fields.summary: Warn user when removing object connected to issue

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Use case
One of the [Insight post functions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagementserver/post-functions-1044784443.html], "Set a Jira custom field with the attribute value from a selected object" allows an object attribute value of a selected object to be retrieved and set it to another target custom field. 

Supported fields are Jira Text fields, Jira User Fields, Jira Group Fields and Insight custom fields. 

This, however, does not support Insight referenced custom fields and not even the [dot notation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagementserver/advanced-searching-iql-insight-query-language-1044784588.html#Advancedsearching:IQLInsightQueryLanguage-Dotnotation]. 

h3. Suggestion
It'd be great if dot notation is supported in Insight post functions, especially the "Set a Jira custom field with the attribute value from a selected object" so that we can use dot notation to get information from the referenced attribute and set a Jira custom field with that
fields.summary: Make "dot-notation" available in Post function

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: It is a request for improvement.The field widht of the Insight item is narrow and the item name is not displayed until the end, so it is difficult to select it.I would appreciate the item width to be widened by 1.2 times to 1.5 times as large as the current item on the item edit screen and display screen of Insight.Also, it will be nice if you can freely change the width of the Insight item.
fields.summary: 【Improvement request】I want you to broaden the width of the Insight item

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Enhance Insight UI to support a comment based object search.  Eg find all objects which have comments holding QQQ assigned.Benefit: Users can interactively search for objects by means of text in comments.See also [{color:#0000ff}[https://portal.riada.se/servicedesk/customer/portal/12/RPS-6501]{color}]Pls implement in ICS and in ICC.
fields.summary: Enhance Insight UI to support a comment based object search

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Enhance Insight UI to support a attachment based object search. i.e. find all objects which have attachments assigned. Search parameter meight be attachment's Name & attachment's file type & attachment's size. Benefit: Users can interactively search for objects having attachments assigned.Should be avialable in ICS and ICC
fields.summary: Enhance Insight UI to support a attachment based object search.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: h3. ContextConsider the following use case: we have 2 Insight custom fields - a regular Insight custom field and a Referenced custom field. Let's say the first one is meant to select a computer, the next shows the installed software.Both fields have the option to add an Insight object from a Jira issue through standard Insight functionality.h3. Current behaviour # When I click the create Insight Object icon next to the _computer_ custom field, the add object dialog immediately shows the computer object attributes. This is as expected (/). # When I click the create Insight Object icon next to the _software_ referenced field, the dialog has the entire Insight object tree available.  (x)h3. Expected behaviourWhen I create an Insight Object from a referenced custom field on a Jira option, I want just the object type associated with the custom field to be selected in the create object dialog. The user *should NOT have the option to create other object types*from the dialog.
fields.summary: Creating Insight Object from referenced custom field does not retain object context from the custom field

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: We really love the new feature that makes it possible to link to objects from another scheme. Really great! Therefor it would be very useful if it was shown in the attribute overview that is is from another scheme (and perhaps also which scheme).
fields.summary: See that it is an Object from another scheme

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Why does IQL have STARTS_WITH but not NOT_STARTA_WITH? Please implement. Same goes for quite a few others. We should be able to negate all kind of searches.
fields.summary: NOT_STARTS_WITH

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: In the Custom Field Object Finder / Object Picker screen, see Dynamic search results, just like the Object Search in Insight Object Schema Browser, based on the String typed, without having to click Enter.
fields.summary: CF Object Picker - to have Dynamic Search

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: It would be really useful if we could use placeholders within URL attribute fields to enable dynamic links.
fields.summary: Placeholders in URL attribute fields

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: We would like to see the ability to add attachments during the create object step. Currently we have to create the object and then go find it and then attach the document.
fields.summary: Ability to add attachments during object create

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: We import data from many different sources.The different sources often have inconsequent names on the same Models and Manufacturers, and sometimes also within the same source.This makes searching and reporting in Insight difficult when data is imported there. Example:SCCM says a computer model name is "HP EliteBook 8570p"Another source says the model name is "EliteBook 8570p"This leads to the objects of this model in Insight having two different names, so if one wants to report on all object of this model, one have to know all different variations. Other asset tools have a "Normaliztion Alias" functionality where models and manufacturers can be standarized/normalized before the value is stored on the object.Insight should also have this functionality.
fields.summary: Standarization of values/Aliasing/Normalizing

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Could the referenced object window be sizable, please?
fields.summary: Resize the Referenced Objects Window in the Graph - Tree View

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hi, Any chance of having tabs within Objects so we can categorize our data within each Object?Many CMDB's have this ability and i wondered when Insight would get this feature. As an example, if you have a Macbook as an Object, you could have this broken down into (HW, Licenses, Financial & warranty information etc) as currently this is all within one Object, which ends up with a wall of information. Cheers,
fields.summary: Tabs in Objects

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hi,We have configured an Insight customfield where the IQL retrieves all existing assets of the schema.Now we have some scenarios to just select a subset of all assets within the customfield via the popup window. E.g. select all assets of object type "Virtual Server" or "Firewall".If I open the popup window of the customfield for selecting these assets I have the possibility to select the object type in the hierarchy tree and then all assets of the selected object type are listed to the right. Or I have the possibility to use the search bar on the top to filter on assets. By now I have then to click on each individual asset to have it selected for the customfield.We would like to have the possibility to click on "Select all" to avoid clicking on each individial asset (see screenshot). I think you can imagine that this is very time consuming if you need to click on 100 assets one by one.We would be very appreciated if you could consider this feature request in one of your next releases.Thank you and best regards,Manuel Lindner
fields.summary: Select-all option in customfield popup (Object Picker) when filtered by object type or search

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hi,Currently we have a CRM built in Jira where we have issue types for Customer, Contact and Case.We have migrated our customers and contacts to Insight and we want to keep their cases (all things they might want to contact us about) as Jira issues.We have configured Insight objects, Customers and Contacts, to be referenced from these Jira issues (cases). Now our sales department wants to be able to be able to view all customer's cases from the customer object view screen.There is the "Connected Jira issues" panel on Insight's object screen, but that panel is very limited.We need the columns to be configurable and the location of the panel to change, ideally to be either above or below the "Avtiviti" panel and to be as wide as that one.Is this possible?If not, would you consider this as a feature request?If yes, when do you think you could implement it?I attach a screenshot with everything explained.!image-2018-07-20-14-03-08-632.png!
fields.summary: Modify the way "Connected Jira issues" are rendered

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hi,When adding an Insight custom field with option Multiple, it should be nice if we can indicate a maximum of selected options by the users.If option is Multiple and maximum is 3, then only three values can be selected.
fields.summary: Maximum select on Insight multiple custom field

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hello, I recommend you give a user the ability to set an Object Type as being Abstract from the “Create Object Type” window and not only once the Object Type is created. It creates extra steps which slows things down when many have to be created.
fields.summary: Creating Object Types - Option: Abstract in "create window"

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hi,Supporting Jira number custom fields in Insight post-functions, where you can set a Jira custom field with the attribute value from a selected object, would be nice to have.Thanks.Ref: https://portal.riada.se/servicedesk/customer/portal/12/RPS-7362
fields.summary: Set a Jira custom field with the attribute value from a selected object

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: the functionality the business is looking for within the Insight add-on. *Current:* **  * Users with the current permissions can upload attachments to objects in Insight (users without the correct permissions can only download attachments, not upload them) * More than 1 attachment can be uploaded (there is no override of the most recent version) * A timestamp is added  !image-2018-08-15-13-06-38-102.png! *Future*:  * The current functionality is retained, and additionally:o   There is a check-in, checkout mechanism * Users can check-out (i.e.: lock) an attachment, which disables the ability to add new attachments (until checked-in) * Users can check-in an attachment only if it is not checked out * The newly checked-in attachment overrides the previously checked in attachmento   The name of the user who currently has the attachment checked out is denotedo   A super user (i.e.: project admin, Jira admin) can force check-in a document (in the use case where an individual who has checked out the attachment is on vacation or has left the team)
fields.summary: Insight Attachments - Check-In/Checkout Functionality

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: When maintaining data in mass, many users say that if there is a batch selector, it will be great. Scenario:Choose 300 objects out of 5,000 objects, currently only by clicking one by one through the object selector, or by marking a unique value for 300 objects, then filtering, and then selecting all. Problem:the way to search bulk objects through IQL is unfriendly to non technical users. A batch selector can either batch select objects or batch query them on a page (even better if it supports export results). Function:randomly select 300 objects according to the number "300" (IQL does not support counting？).Or, user fill in the known 300 object labels into the object selector (one per line), and automatically display all matched objects，and user can selector 300 object.
fields.summary: Batch selector

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Is it possible to generate a report (or export to excel) an object with its attributes, and the attributes of referenced objects?For example, if I have an employee named A who uses "laptop1" with S/N "SN1".I created an object called Laptop with attributes:name, and S/NI created another object called "employee" with attributes: name and laptop.Can I export the employee name, laptop name, and S/N in one excel sheet?I know too much details, but just to make the request clear :)
fields.summary: More detailed asset management report

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: It does not appear possible to add characters using regular expression during import. Please add this functionality, possibly in the data locator input.For example:Data locators - [firstName][lastName][userName]Sample Data - John Smith jsmith123Using \s (space) as the concatenator, we would like to re-write the Insight attribute with additional characters such that the field output becomes "John Smith (jsmith123)"
fields.summary: Add characters to fields during import

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: I’ve gotten the status field to output the "Stoplight" dashboard our users are looking for based on 3 different critical milestone dates, the colors in the Insight Query/List View and Confluence Insight Macro report are very subtle/subdued than they are when selecting them from the Insight Edit view, especially the Yellow and Green. Could Riada change the CSS styling to fill in the white centers with the color selected and then toggle the font color to White for Green and Red? Black font is likely best for Yellow fill. Screen shots attached to assist you in understanding this problem.
fields.summary: Status Lozenges Colors are muted/barely visible in queries and Confluence reports

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: When inheritance is activated, an attribute name has to be unique in the whole underlying structure. We wasn't able to create a new attribute due name conflict, but hasn't any clue where in our structure the attribute name has already been used. See picture for example: !image-2018-09-07-14-28-35-639.png|thumbnail! To find where the attribute name has already been used, we had to check every child object types clicking one by one and check the attributes.We suggest to extend the error message to include the name of the object type, where the attribute name has already been used: e.g. "Name has to be unique! Attribute name already used for object type 'company' ". (Maybe the object type name should be a link to direct jump to the object type).
fields.summary: Extend "Name has to be unique!" error message

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hi,When moving an object, the wizard informs the user about attributes in the destination object type which are required to complete the move. There are some cases where the attribute does not exist in the current object type. Rather than re-create the object in the destination object type and delete the existing object, losing issue connections, it would be an improvement to be able to enter values for the required attributes during the move wizard.Thanks,Matt
fields.summary: Ability to add values to required attributes in destination object type when moving an object

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Each field of jira is only allowed to store "one copy" of content in an issue.Dynamic form functionality is required when there is a need to change the correspondence between groups of objects and attributes. That is, in the same issue, the attribute a of the modified object 1 is y, and the attribute a of the object 2 can also be modified as z.The “Dynamic Forms” plugin is great if it supports the Insight user field.
fields.summary: Dynamic form

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hey team!!It would be great if the Confluence link attribute had an ability to resolve a pasted Confluence page URL. The search results you get today are lacking and are not the same results you get from Confluence Search bar.Cheers!!
fields.summary: Confluence Attribute - Add possibility to add direct URL to page

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Currently JSON import have to use an array to define a selector, the problem is the array format is using pipe "|" to distinguish the array cells.This is not the JSON internal format. The one should be used is a comma. Check [this link|https://www.w3schools.com/js/js_json_arrays.asp]It's hard to change the JSON format across platforms especially when it's not he international format and requires more manual labor.
fields.summary: JSON - It should be possible to import JSON with the conventional format

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: It would be really nice that Insight has the possibility to provide you an asset number (with a predefined pattern) when you create an object.For example if you can define a pattern (PC0001 until PC9999) and when you create an object it will provide you the first available asset number. After creation of the new object it will link the asset label to the asset number.It is related to issue: ICS-1007
fields.summary: Asset numbering

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Insight custom fields in Jira have the option to create an Insight object by clicking the "Create an object" icon available to the right of the field.When the "Create an object" icon is selected next to an Insight Referenced Object field, the Object Type selection defaults to the first Object Type alphabetically, so users have to change to the correct Object Type. The Insight Object/s field, on the other hand, will default to the correct Object Type.The "Create an object" feature on Insight Referenced Object fields should behave like Insight Object/s fields and default to the appropriate Object Type.
fields.summary: Create objects from custom field improvement

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: The API allowed the attachment with a NULL mimeType, which resulted in NPE when navigating to the Object. I would suggest to default mimeType = "application/octet-stream" so that any unknown type is treated as a binary upload.
fields.summary: Default Mime Type for attachments if none was provided by the APIs
